Factsheet

Request Press Copy

Description

Death's web is a 2D roguelite that was inspired dead cells and rogue legacy. The unique mechanic is the cursed system. Curses harm you in various game-changing ways and blessings support you. It also has a lot of lore that you can dive into and the combat allows for the player to create awesome synergies.

History

I started developing Death's Web because I love roguelites and found the idea of creating one intriguing. I worked on the game after school, during weekends, on train rides, and even throughout my exchange in Japan. During development, I increased the number of "worlds" from four to eight and introduced the "Cursed System." Inspired by Blazing Beaks' artifact system, I wanted something more interesting. The artefact system often only applies minor debuffs. I thought this was too boring and could be done more interesting. I tried to make each curse alter gameplay. (For example, one curse creates a spiky wall that slowly chases you, while the another delays your jump by a split second.) The blessings also influence gameplay in unconventional ways. While some are straightforward buffs, others require creative adaptation. One blessing allows you to double jump, while another lets you partially heal after taking damage—but only if you stop moving. Initially, I didn’t plan to focus much on the story, but if there was only combat it would be monotonous. I decided to balance the intensity of battles with the calme cities, adding depth and narrative progression. But combat remained my primary focus. During my time in Japan, I gave each weapon type a unique mechanic. The five weapon types—swords, broadswords, scythes, spells, and bows—each have distinct effects inspired by Dead Cells and Tears of the Kingdom, though almost all of the specific abilities are my original creations.

Features

  • The Cursed System: To receive blessings, you must pick up curses and carry them to the shaman. Blessings grant you powerful abilities, while curses will do everything they can to bring your journey to an end. (Eyamples: One blessing, makes it possible to completely absorb the damage of a hit. one curse, ill poison you if you stop moving.)
  • Cities and Story: There are many cities and over 50 characters! You'll even be able to meet travellers while trying to reach the center of the blessed lands. In the cities you'll find out about what happend in this kingdom about the many different species that live there and what happend to the humans and the gods.
  • Combat and bosses: There are many ways to create synergies. There are simple ones like using a weapon that stuns an enemies and one that deals extra damage to stunned enemies. A more complex one would be to get many blessings, many spell slots with low mana cost spells and a weapon that deals extra damage per spell cast in the last few seconds. There are over 10 bosses, 8 "worlds", over 50 weapons, over 25 spells, over 50 curses and blessings.
  • Soul system: Kill enemies to get their souls. To use the souls you'll have to save them at soul spheres. Use the souls to get permanent upgrades.
